title: Kinetic friction between block and materials

content.question: Blocks 1 and 2 are connected by a light string that passes over a pulley with negligible mass and friction, as shown in the figure. Block 1 is on a table covered with two different materials, A and B. The two-block system is released from rest, and the speed of block 1 begins to increase. When block 1 reaches material B, its speed increases at a greater rate. Which of the following correctly compares the coefficient of kinetic friction <math alttext="mu" overflow="scroll"><mi>μ</mi></math> between block 1 and the two materials and describes the change in the magnitude of the net force on block 2 as block 1 slides from material A to material B?

choices.label: CoefficientsNet Force<math alttext="mu sub A, is greater than mu sub B" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>A</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>B</mi></msub></math> Decreases
CoefficientsNet Force<math alttext="mu sub A, is greater than mu sub B" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>A</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>B</mi></msub></math> Increases
CoefficientsNet Force<math alttext="mu sub A, is less than mu sub B" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>A</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>B</mi></msub></math> Increases
CoefficientsNet Force<math alttext="mu sub A, is less than mu sub B" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>A</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>B</mi></msub></math> Decreases

content.answer: CoefficientsNet Force<math alttext="mu sub A, is greater than mu sub B" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>A</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>B</mi></msub></math> Increases

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
